ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I never experience studio visits so that was really nice to have. Also I really enjoyed listening to my peers about there passions and projects. I definitely took away a lot of inspiration from their pieces.
Learned about my peers practices & got inspired!
We formed a community of undergrad artist and had our first show!
Learned how to appreciate many forms of art, and to think from other perspectives when creating different forms of art!
I gained exposure to many artists and got to work on my senior project.
I learned how to give and receive feedback that was more theoretical than technical.
Constructive critique in preparing for final thesis.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: please...not at 9am.
More required crits/clearer messaging about which crits are for which people/how many we should be signing up for
I think that we should no longer do slide show presentations and follow the X crit model of the MFA
A bit disorganized, and lack of direction
I'd love to see more collaboration among students. It's heavily individual because of the nature of a senior project, but it would be great if there were opportunities for us to collaborate more.
A strength is being able to see your peers' creative processes. A weakness is that this class is on a Friday morning.
I think that the professor and students were very helpful in giving comments that were constructive and thoughtful. Seeing others works was also helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Maybe some more CPAR majors would benefit from taking this class.
Its required!
Yes! Go to class!
Yes, it will help you start your senior project.
As a requirement, yes.
Yes, it is required
